repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Making a difference in an
            European Union member state

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on
            Bulgaria’s economy. Bulgaria has come a long way from its
            difficult early years of transition to a market economy.
            Country’s’ main challenges were to mitigate the negative
            impact of the global economic crisis, to enhance
            productivity, and to strengthen public institutions and
            governance to accelerate convergence of living standards to
            average European Union countries. The Revenue Administration
            and Reform Project supported the integration of tax and
            social contribution revenue collection, to improve the
            effectiveness and efficiency of the public revenue
            collection system in Bulgaria and facilitate private sector
            development. The Social Investment and Employment Promotion
            Project brought school improvements, energy efficiency,
            water supply and sewerage to small villages, and enabled
            rehabilitation of homes for the elderly and for children
            without parental care. The Registration and Cadastre Project
            contributed to a secure and efficient real estate market.
            Bulgaria continued to make great strides in improving
            financial management and channeling increased revenue to
            programs that were delivering improved water connections,
            better schools, and renovated homes for the elderly.

Nivel de vida mejora en Bulgaria por su
            ingreso a la Unión Europea

This Results Profile focuses on
            Bulgaria’s economy. Bulgaria has come a long way from its

            Country’s’ main challenges were to mitigate the negative
            impact of the global economic crisis, to enhance
            productivity, and to strengthen public institutions and
            governance to accelerate convergence of living standards to

            water supply and sewerage to small villages, and enabled
            rehabilitation of homes for the elderly and for children
            without parental care. The Registration and Cadastre Project
            contributed to a secure and efficient real estate market.
            Bulgaria continued to make great strides in improving
            financial management and channeling increased revenue to

            better schools, and renovated homes for the elderly.

repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Social Investment and Employment
            Promotion Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Investment and
            Employment Promotion Project for Bulgaria were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Lessons learned include:
            well-designed sub-projects can simultaneously create
            short-term jobs and improve infrastructure and facilities
            that are critical to preserving country's human
            resources. Well-targeted micro-projects can be a
            particularly useful instrument at the time of economic
            crisis to ensure employment and keep families from falling
            into poverty. Sub-projects can contribute to country's
            broader efforts to decentralize the provision of public
            goods and services to local governments in a way that also
            helps local governments fight poverty. The experience of
            social funds around the world suggests that delegation of
            sub-project preparation and implementation tasks to local
            governments bodes well for greater benefits in terms of
            local governance, accountability, local capacity building,
            and sustainability of local services. Indicators for the
            achievement of project outcomes need to be selected from
            those available sources of data that are periodical enough
            to enable measuring of outcomes by project closing.

repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria case : making a difference in an
            EU member state

abstracts.cdata!:
Bulgaria's efforts to transition to
            a market economy were rewarded by membership in the European
            Union (EU) in 2007 but the country still faced steep
            challenges to elevate the income of its more than seven
            million people to the average seen in the EU. Partnering
            with International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
            (IBRD), Bulgaria continues to make great strides in
            improving financial management, channeling increased revenue
            to programs that are delivering new or improved water
            connections, better schools, and renovated homes for the elderly.

docna.cdata!:
Bulgaria case : making a difference in an EU
            member state

display_title.display_title:
Bulgaria case : making a
            difference in an EU member state
